title: Helen Skelton displays her phenomenal physique in tiny blue bikini
text:
Last month, Helen Skelton admitted she was an 'emotional wreck' when her kids headed off to kick off the school year.

So the Countryfile frontwoman, 36, was undoubtedly keen to be reunited with her tots over the half-term break as she took to Instagram to share images from her trip to Greece with her husband Richie Myler and kids Ernie, four, and Louis, two.

Looking incredible in the blue two-piece, she larked around on the boat with the lifejacket-clad tots before launching herself into the sea.

Her boys: Helen Skelton was keen to be reunited with her tots over the half-term break as she took to Instagram to share images from her trip to Greece

Helen looked sensational in a sexy blue two-piece which displayed her perky cleavage and taut abs as well as her lithe limbs.

Her blonde tresses were tied in a knot at the nape of her neck while loose tendrils framed her make-up free face, which was adorned with sunglasses.

She was not only displaying her own incredible figure but also showing off Richie's physique as he emerged from the water looking ripped.

Helen recently admitted she was an 'emotional wreck' following Ernie's first ever 'chaotic' day at school.

Stunner: Helen looked sensational in a sexy blue two-piece which displayed her perky cleavage and taut abs as well as her lithe limbs

Hands on mummy! She was flanked by the tots on the boat

Sharing a throwback snap of them on holiday, the presenter admitted that she didn't understand how other parents had managed to get a snap of their children in their uniform because she had such a 'chaotic' morning.

Helen penned: 'Emotional wreck. How the hell is everyone getting cute first day photos, we were wrestling trousers, dodging scooters, trying not to cry, engaging with new parents.... first morning at school was chaos.

'Four and half years of doing what we want, when we want ends today. I’m sure he’s going to love it. But will I!!??? Selfish. Yes. Honest. Yes...

'Thanks for the adventures so far Ernie bear. #schoolstarter #mybaby #newchapter #routinesucks #howdowegettherefor9am #adventure #school.'

Aside from her holiday excitement and school woes, Helen recently revealed she suffered a devastating fraud - in which she was robbed of £70,000.

Pained: Helen recently admitted she was an 'emotional wreck' following Ernie's first ever 'chaotic' day at school

was contacted by her ‘bank’ and told there was suspicious activity on her account, her initial shock was softened by the kindly manner of the caller.

The problem, she was told, most likely derived from her decision to renew her television licence online the previous day — a transaction similar to many that most of us make unthinkingly. On this occasion, however, it appeared that the activity had led to someone trying to hack her account.

‘The one consolation was that the bank was so nice about it,’ Helen recalls. ‘I remember the guy told me not to feel stupid, it was happening all the time and this particular scam was even foxing their best security people.’

That consolation was short-lived: over ensuing days, as thousands disappeared from Helen’s bank account, it became clear that the apparently empathetic chat had all been part of the scam. The phone call had not come from her bank, but from the person defrauding her.
